thread.title: This Australian company is clucking mad
thread.title_full: This Australian company is clucking mad

title: This Australian company is clucking mad
text: Big trends in simple home theatre 7:00 AM Rod Chester and Jennifer Dudley-Nicholson Home theatre trends for 2015 are clear: we all want simple, wireless units that are big on screen size and low on cost. Is this the death of the password? 1:01 AM Network Writers REMEMBERING passwords is a modern day hazard. Now, Yahoo says it has scrapped passwords and found a more secure way for you to log in to your email. Look mum — I can finally go nuts for peanuts 0:40 AM BRAD CROUCH MEDICAL REPORTER DOCTORS at Flinders Medical Centre are using a world-first two-step technique to treat children with dangerous peanut allergies — now the kids are downing nuts by the handful. How your car could save your life 0:00 AM Sue Dunlevy National Health Reporter THE technology to cut the road toll is available — now all we need is for politicians to make it compulsory on new cars. Social media online video wars heating up 21:17 PM Yoni Heisler FACEBOOK has revealed its new multi-pronged plan for online video domination and the folks at Google are a little worried. Astronomers find ‘something aliens would build’ 21:03 PM Matthew Dunn ASTRONOMERS have stumbled across what they believe   Parents blamed for violent video games 19:54 PM MATTHEW DUNN IF your children are playing violent video games, you could be to blame. It turns out your parenting style could be an influence.
